semantics.label: Notation
semantics.description: Define the notation in Lilypond syntax (absolute pitch marking for octaves)

semantics.label: Show from notation
semantics.description: What you want to show to the student. Usually key, time and the first note

fields.default: Listen to the musical excerpt, write down the notation
The project is supported by European Social Fund
You can use the following sohrtcuts to enter or change the music:
Click somewhere on the screen first to activate the shortcuts!
Note names: keys c, d, e, f, g, a, b, h. Uppercase (C, D, etc) stands for 2nd octave, ctrl + note name for the small octave.
Durations: 1 - whole note, 2 - halfnote, 4 -  quarter, 8 -  eighths, 6 -  sixteenths
Raise or lower note (enharmonics included): arrow up or down
Navigation:  left or right moves to the next note, ctrl+left/right to the next/previous bar.
Click between the notes to insert notes in the middle of the bar.
is not a recognized note or keyword.
NB! This is not an official H5P.org content type. With any problems please turn to the author tarmo.johannes@muba.edu.ee
